intro: Spermacoce buchneri, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its showy, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a sweet fragrance. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slight pubescence. Spermacoce buchneri is typically found in woodland and shrubland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
